sn40.6:3.1: 6 A Question About the Dimension of Infinite Consciousness
sn40.6:4.1: “‘They speak of this thing called the “dimension of infinite consciousness”.
sn40.6:4.2: What is the dimension of infinite consciosness?’
sn40.6:4.4: ‘It’s when a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that “consciousness is infinite”, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
sn40.6:4.5: This is called the dimension of infinite consciousness.’
sn40.6:4.6: And so … I was entering and remaining in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
sn40.6:4.7: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by the dimension of infinite space beset me.
sn40.6:5.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic powers and said:
sn40.6:5.3: Don’t neglect the dimension of infinite consciousness, brahmin! Settle your mind in the dimension of infinite consciousness; unify your mind and bring it to samādhi in the dimension of infinite consciousness.’
sn40.6:5.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
sn40.6:5.5: So if anyone should be rightly called
sn40.6:5.6: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
